text:
57M with ILD (?NSIP) on prednisone 20 mg daily at home, Afib s/p recent
   ablation; transfer from OSH after admission [**2111-4-10**] for dyspnea,
   hypoxia, and hemoptysis.  Recent admit to OSH from [**2111-4-7**] to [**2111-4-9**] for
   TEE and Afib catheter ablation.  Discharged on coumadin and lovenox
   until INR >2.  Prior to discharge, had small volume hemoptysis x few
   episodes, attributed to intubation for procedure.  On the day following
   discharge, patient presented to [**Location (un) 5726**] in [**Location (un) 206**] with c/o
   dyspnea and more episodes of small volume hemoptysis.  CTA was
   performed and was negative for PE.  Transferred to [**Hospital 2852**] hospital
   (had ablation there).  CT reviewed and thought to have diffuse ground
   glass opacities.  Admitted to the medicine floor, continued on O2 by
   simple FM with gradual increase up to 10 L/min.  Continued having
   hemoptysis.  IV steroid dose increased.  Transferred to [**Hospital1 5**] given
   that his pulmonologist ([**Doctor Last Name **]) is located here.
   Pt intubated on [**4-16**], central line and a-line placed, bronched during
   day of [**4-16**] and started on high dose IV steroids for ?pulmonary
   vasculitis.
   Diabetes Mellitus (DM), Type II
   Assessment:
   Pt with history of DM Cont to get Steroids 1000 mg/day. and TF at goal
   On insulin at 11 units/hr
   Action:
    Q1H  finger stick ranged anywhere from 160 to 120,Insulin gtt down to
   10 units/hr. Given steroids as ordered.
   Response:
    Cont Insulin gtt and finger stick Q2H.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor finger sticks q2h and titrate Insulin gtt as
   needed.
   Interstitial Lung Disease (ILD including IPF, UIP, NSIP, DIP, LIP, etc)
   Assessment:
   Pt received on AC, FiO2 50%/550/18/, RR 22-24 with sats 92-96%.   Pt
   suctioned for scant amount of blood tinged secretions.  Cont Fentanyl
   at 200 mics and Versed 9mg/hr. BLS coarse to clear upper side and
   diminish at the baes.
   Action:
    No changes made on the vent. Pt did require bolus sedation for turning
   [**2-2**] agitation and desat to 88 % with turning.
   Response:
    This morning ABG was 7.41/ 41/79.
   Plan:
    Closely monitor resp status.  Wean ventilator and sedation as pt
   tolerates, trend ABG.  Suction PRN.
